channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trip Hazard on Sidewalk Adjacent to 103 Redpoll Way, Erith, 28th August
item.description:
The hazard has been caused by tree root activity from a tree planted and maintained by Peabody Housing Association as part of their Park Improvement works. The roots have lifted and damaged the pavement surface, creating an uneven walkway which poses a significant risk to pedestrians. I have previously raised this issue directly with Peabody (letter hand-delivered on 11th August 2025), but to date I have received no acknowledgement or response. In the meantime, the condition of the pavement continues to deteriorate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kale Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vandalised phone booth, 28th August
item.description:

item.title: Gipsy Road SE27 9QY outside number 251 (, 28th August
item.description:
Gipsy Road SE27 9QY outside number 251 (Fiona’s Nail Bar) (next to Paxton Place junction) is a black box which I assume relates to the Lambeth vehicle public charger just by it. Black box tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 245, Gipsy Road, West Norwood, London

item.title: Oven fly tipped in Capel House, 28th August
item.description:
Hello, as per my previous report (ref 8069713) there is an oven which was ripped out of a flat in Capel House and left in the stairwell on Floor 3. The previous report was closed as complete but the oven is still there. Please can this be resolved.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Loddiges Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Black refrigerated unit (about 1m x 0.75m x 0.75m) and blag bin bag, left in Penge Lane on the NE side of the rail-over-road bridge about 6m from the kerb edge., 28th August
item.description:
Black refrigerated unit (about 1m x 0.75m x 0.75m) and blag bin bag, left in Penge Lane on the NE side of the rail-over-road bridge about 6m from the kerb edge. This has been separately reported with a photo today, but that report pin is misplaced. I suggest installing covert cameras as this and the other side of the road are hot spots for frequent and significant flytipping
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree weed bush growing at the edge of council property, 28th August
item.description:
A tree weed bush plant is growing untamed at the edge of a council property out of the wall, threatening the structural integrity of the building. The weed bush plant has grown very quickly and is growing in an uncontrolled way along the communal council land / building

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sutherland Square, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree and weed bush completely overgrown making pavement impassible, 28th August
item.description:
A weed plant bush growing around the base of a tree on the street is completely overgrown making the pavement impassible. Users have to step onto the road to get passed. This is particularly problematic for pushchair and wheelchair users as there is no curb nearby.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sutherland Square, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo bags and rats.., 28th August
item.description:
...this mess is spilling over from the bin area of the Living Building, 3 Sherman Road property onto the public footpath. Rats and foxes seen going through all the waste. It's a disgusting mess that is spoiling the area. Please can the mess be cleaned and proper waste management enforced for this property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sherman Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
